pr_title: [BEAM-9603] Add timer family support to FnApiDoFnRunner

timeline.message: [BEAM-9603] Add timer family support to FnApiDoFnRunner
[BEAM-9603] Add timer family support to FnApiDoFnRunner

timeline.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: Could you please add more javadoc/comments about why it's timerId or timerFamilyId?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: If the timerIdOrTimerFamilyId  is for a timer family, should the timerId be the timer.dynamicTimerTag?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText:
it will be ignored anyway, apparently only one of timerId or the timerFamilyId takes effect.

  
    
      beam/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/ByteBuddyDoFnInvokerFactory.java
    
    
         Line 223
      in
      591de34
    
    
    
    

        
          
           (timerFamilyId.isEmpty())
replies.author: y1chi

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/sdks/java/harness/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/fn/harness/FnApiDoFnRunner.java b/sdks/java/harness/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/fn/harness/FnApiDoFnRunner.java
index 7ee066956d..ab07ca319a 100644
--- a/sdks/java/harness/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/fn/harness/FnApiDoFnRunner.java
+++ b/sdks/java/harness/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/fn/harness/FnApiDoFnRunner.java

@@ -976,6 +966,8 @@ public class FnApiDoFnRunner<InputT, RestrictionT, PositionT, WatermarkEstimator
     currentTimer = timer;
     currentTimeDomain = timeDomain;
     onTimerContext = new OnTimerContext<>(timer.getUserKey());
+    // The timerIdOrTimerFamilyId contains either a timerId from timer declaration or timerFamilyId
+    // from timer family declaration.
     String timerId =
         timerIdOrTimerFamilyId.startsWith(TimerFamilyDeclaration.PREFIX)
             ? ""

timeline.bodyText: Similar to FnApiTimer above, we should have timeDomain from proto, right?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

timeline.bodyText: We should consider exposing more APIs here like FnApiTimer. Maybe a TODO here?
timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: I believe we can always call the get() first to access FnApiTimer and call it's APIs. Probably that's sufficient enough? I feel adding more shortcuts only makes the API slightly more user-friendly.
replies.author: y1chi

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the clarification! I still think we should have a better API(and doc) here, like getTimer(timerId)? And I would prefer not exposing set() since getTimer() is a more recommended way. What do you think? You can also start a discussion thread in dev list since it's a user faced API.
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText:
This is the interface required by TimerMap though: 
  
    
      beam/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/state/TimerMap.java
    
    
         Line 25
      in
      9108832
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public interface TimerMap {
replies.author: y1chi

replies.bodyText: probably makes sense to keep the set shortcut since it is the most frequently used one.
replies.author: y1chi

replies.bodyText: I thought it would be good time to revisit the dynamic timer API design but it's not in the scope of this PR. Let's leave it as now. Thanks!
replies.author: boyuanzz

timeline.author: boyuanzz
